The claim is based on a Democratic ad sp: a super PAC that is spending millions to elect Democratic Senate candidates.
The claim states that GOP Rep: Joe Heck of Nevada voted "23 times" against banning terrorists from buying guns.
The fact is: there has not been a single up-or-down vote on such a ban in the House.
None of the 23 votes cited by the ad wou: according to the PAC's own detailed backup statement. All were procedural votes that would have denied "an opportunity" to vote on a measure Democrats wanted to get to the floor if given the chance.
